page.title: 04CAMPERDOWN WORKS,DUNDEE
page.content: {Jute}has been a dominant part of industry in Dundee, but other textiles have become of increasing importance. {Camperdown Works}was owned by the {Cox Brothers,}one of the famous jute families. The works employed 5000 workers and produced 30 - 40 million square yards of cloth per annum. A famous Dundee landmark -{Cox's Stack - is in the centre of the works. This chimney is{282 feet high;}it is made of over{1 million bricks}and cost {Â£6000}to build in 1865. it can be seen{60 miles}away. The Works are now a development site for modern housing and new industrial units, but many think that the Stack should remain as a unique example of industrial architecture and a tribute to the{jute industry}that made Dundee wealthy last century. One possible use is as the gnomon of a giant sundial!
